Package com.amonson.task_manager

Class ControlledShutdown

java.lang.Object
com.amonson.task_manager.ControlledShutdown
public final class ControlledShutdown extends Object
Control a threaded or non-threaded application's shutdown process. This is used to guarantee and orderly shutdown with proper cleanup.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    ControlledShutdown.DebugMessageCallback
    Callback interface for debug messages.
    static class 
    ControlledShutdown.IllegalApplicationState
    Unchecked exception for calling startApplication or endApplication in the wrong order with the wrong prerequisite states.

    Method
    Description
    static void
    endApplication()
    Called near the end of main to signal that all application cleanup was done, child processes or threads and stopped, and the process can end.

  • Method Details

    • startApplication

      public static void startApplication()
      Called near the beginning of main() to setup a shutdown hook.

    • startApplication

      public static void startApplication(ControlledShutdown.DebugMessageCallback callback)
      Called near the beginning of main() to setup a shutdown hook.
      Parameters:
      callback - If not null this functional interface is called during the shutdown hook to help debug issues.
      Throws:
      ControlledShutdown.IllegalApplicationState - when called with a state other than 'NotStarted'.

    • endApplication

      public static void endApplication()
      Called near the end of main to signal that all application cleanup was done, child processes or threads and stopped, and the process can end.
      Throws:
      ControlledShutdown.IllegalApplicationState - when called with a state other than 'ShuttingDown'.

    • isShuttingDown

      public static boolean isShuttingDown()
      This returns true if the shutdown hook was called. This is used on worker threads to determine if the application needs to be shutdown and therefore the worker thread needs to end.
      Returns:
      true when shutting down (shutdown hook is called), false otherwise.

    • waitForShutdown

      public static void waitForShutdown()
      This will block until the shutdown hook is called. This is used when the application is a long running service and there is a need to block on the main thread while work is done on a separate worker thread.

    • manualShutdown

      public static void manualShutdown()
      Call this method if you wish to shutdown the application from a different thread of for a any reason.
      Throws:
      ControlledShutdown.IllegalApplicationState - when called with a state other than 'Started'.
